intro: Biophytum esquirolii, commonly known as the African ice plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Biophytum esquirolii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
